importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The federal government shutdown was in effect on this date, impacting federal workers and public services, leading to economic ripple effects across the U.S.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The shutdown occurred during a specific point in time, affecting federal operations and economic activity on that day and beyond.

keyTakeAways: The federal government shutdown has led to widespread layoffs of federal workers, directly affecting employment and income levels.
Local businesses, both in Washington, DC, and outside national parks, are struggling to hire staff due to reduced workforce availability.
Federally-backed housing loans have been halted, preventing individuals from moving into new homes and impacting real estate markets.
The shutdown has a direct financial impact on individuals’ personal budgets and businesses' ability to operate and remain solvent.

namedEntities.name: federal government
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A branch of the U.S. government responsible for executing laws and providing public services.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The federal government shutdown directly disrupts public services and employment, leading to cascading economic effects on individuals and businesses.

namedEntities.name: federal workers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Government employees working in federal agencies and departments.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Federal workers are being laid off in large numbers, reducing household incomes and contributing to economic instability.

namedEntities.name: local businesses
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Small to medium-sized businesses operating in local communities, including in Washington, DC, and outside national parks.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: These businesses face difficulties in hiring staff and maintaining operations during the shutdown, affecting their revenue and survival.

namedEntities.name: Washington, DC
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The capital city of the United States, home to many federal offices and institutions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The shutdown has significantly impacted businesses and services in Washington, DC, where federal operations are concentrated.

namedEntities.name: national parks
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Federal lands managed by the National Park Service and open to the public.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Businesses outside national parks are affected, indicating that the shutdown’s economic impact extends beyond urban and tourist-centric areas.

namedEntities.name: federally-backed housing loans
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Loans guaranteed or supported by the federal government to assist with home ownership.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The halt in these loans prevents people from moving into new homes, disrupting personal financial planning and real estate markets.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The federal government shutdown has had wide-reaching financial consequences, including mass layoffs of federal workers, difficulty for local businesses to hire staff, and a halt in federally-backed housing loans. This has created significant economic strain on individuals and small businesses, affecting personal finances and business sustainability across the U.S., particularly in Washington, DC and outside national parks.
title: How has the federal government shutdown affected your wallet?
